activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby J Shelby Jr

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
10/26/2022 date on preliminary hearing calendar rescheduled due to power outage.

2:51 PM Defendant Bobby J Shelby Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
Defendant is not eligible for SPD.
Defendant filed PFAC.
BTC: Racine county atty appointed. Repayment rate of $50/Month commencing in 60 Days.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bobby J Shelby Jr
Current: 3121 Wheelock Dr Apt #5, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2022)
Prior: 3121 Wheelock Dr, Racine, WI 53405 United States

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.  No contact with the victim K.V (person, property, residence or family).

**AMENDED ON 9-2-22: Bond modified to allow the deft. an exception for work on house arrest, GPS monitoring.  Deft. to provide RCAP with his work schedule. Deft. allowed to drive for work purposes only.**

2:38 PM Defendant Bobby J Shelby Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Deft. is not eligible for SPD.  Deft. believes he should be eligible because he cannot work on house arrest.  Deft. asks the court to allow him to work on bond.  Deft. works for Gleason Redimix driving truck. BTC: Bond modified to allow the deft. an exception for work.  Deft. to provide RCAP with his work schedule. Deft. allowed to drive for work purposes only. Deft. to hire an atty.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
